accuracy.description: The correctness of the final answer provided by the agent.

accepted_values: Incorrect
Partially correct/Correct with insignificant errors
Fully correct and complete

completeness.description: The extent to which the multi-agent system addressed all parts of the question.

accepted_values: The response did not address the question.
The response partially addressed the question.
The response fully addressed the question.

efficiency.description: The number of steps taken to arrive at the answer and the relevance of each step.

accepted_values: Inefficient with irrelevant or redundant steps.
Moderate efficiency with some relevant steps.
Highly efficient with no wasted steps.

reasoning_traceability.description: The clarity of the agent's reasoning process and whether it can be followed and understood.

accepted_values: Illogical or incomprehensible reasoning.
Reasoning traceable with some effort.
Clear and easily traceable reasoning.

data_veracity.description: The reliability of the data sources used by the agent and the avoidance of data contamination.

accepted_values: Unreliable data sources and presence of data contamination.
Mainly reliable data sources but with some potential data contamination.
Completely reliable data sources with no data contamination.

robustness.description: The agent's ability to handle diverse and complex parts of the question without failure.

accepted_values: The system fails with complex/diverse steps.
The system manages complexity/diversity with occasional failure.
The system consistently handles complexity/diversity with no failure.

response_time.description: The time taken by the agent to provide the final answer from when the question was posed.

accepted_values: Long response time, significantly above average.
Moderate response time, around average.
Quick response time, significantly below average.
